Package com.lpoo.redstonetools.controller.circuit

Class CircuitController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lpoo.redstonetools.controller.circuit.CircuitController
  • public class CircuitController
extends java.lang.Object

    Circuit Controller

    Circuit controller handles the job of notifying the tiles of updates on a circuit
    See Also:
    Circuit

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_UPDATES

        private static final int MAX_UPDATES

        Maximum number of updates in a run

        Maximum number of updates a position can have in a single update event
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • updateTracker

        private java.util.Map<Position,​java.lang.Integer> updateTracker

        Controller update tracker

        Used to keep track of the number of updates of certain position to detect infinite loops and unstable circuits

    • Method Detail

      • loadCircuit

        public static Circuit loadCircuit​(java.lang.String filename)
                           throws InvalidCircuitException

        Loads a circuit from a .ser file

        Parameters:
        filename - File containing the Circuit object to be loaded
        Returns:
        Loaded circuit upon success
        Throws:
        InvalidCircuitException - Thrown otherwise
        See Also:
        Serializable

      • saveCircuit

        public static boolean saveCircuit​(Circuit circuit,
                                  java.lang.String filename)

        Saves a Circuit to a .ser file

        Changes the filename to always end in ".ser"
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit to be saved
        filename - File for the object to be saved
        Returns:
        True upon success, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Serializable

      • getNewController

        public CircuitController getNewController()

      • addTile

        public void addTile​(Circuit circuit,
                    Tile tile)

        Adds tile to circuit

        Wrapper of circuit addTile function On top of adding the tile to the circuit, it handles the process of notifying all neighbour wires of the addition in order to update the wire connections
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where tile will be added
        tile - Tile to be added
        See Also:
        Circuit.addTile(Tile)

      • interact

        public void interact​(Circuit circuit,
                     Position position)

        Interacts with the tile at position

        Wrapper of interact function On top of interacting with the tile, updates the neighbour tiles if needed
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where tile will be added
        position - Position of the Tile to be interacted with
        See Also:
        Tile.interact(Circuit)

      • advanceTick

        public void advanceTick​(Circuit circuit)

        Advances to the next tick of the circuit

        Wrapper of circuit advanceTick function On top of updating the circuit tick, it handles all the updates that need to be done on each tick
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit to advance the tick
        See Also:
        Circuit.nextTick()

      • updateAllNeighbourTiles

        public void updateAllNeighbourTiles​(Circuit circuit,
                                    Position position)

        Sends updates to all neighbours tiles

        Sends updates to all neighbour tiles if the tile that originated the update outputs on that side
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where the updates are being done
        position - Position of the tile that originated the update

      • updateNeighbourTile

        public void updateNeighbourTile​(Circuit circuit,
                                Position position,
                                int power,
                                Side side)

        Sends update to a neighbour tile

        Sends update to the neighbour tile of the side specified, if that tile generates an update it will be started a new chain of updates of the neighbour tiles.
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where the updates are being done
        position - Position of the tile that originated the update
        power - Power level to send on the update
        side - Side of the tile where the update will be sent to

      • forceUpdateIO

        public void forceUpdateIO​(Circuit circuit,
                          int power,
                          Side side)

        Updates IO port of the side specified on the circuit and triggers updates

        Triggers update on IO port of circuit, allowing to propagate signals to sub-circuits This is a special case of update that doesn't use the update function of the tile
        Parameters:
        circuit - Sub circuit where IO port needs to be updated
        power - Power received
        side - Side of the tile where the update will be sent to
        See Also:
        IOTile.update(Circuit, int, Side)

      • updateSubCircuit

        public void updateSubCircuit​(Circuit circuit,
                             Tile subCircuit)

        Updates circuit's sub-circuit tile

        Triggers an update on all IO ports of the sub-circuit
        Parameters:
        circuit - Main circuit where update is taking place
        subCircuit - Sub-circuit to be updated

      • notifyNeighbourTiles

        public void notifyNeighbourTiles​(Circuit circuit,
                                 Position position)

        Notifies all neighbour tiles of change on the tile specified

        Sends a notification to all neighbours of the tile specified to handle the updates on the tile connections
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where updates are being done
        position - Position of the tile that generated the update
        See Also:
        Tile.updateConnections(Circuit)

      • rotateTileLeft

        public void rotateTileLeft​(Circuit circuit,
                           Position position)

        Rotates a tile of the circuit to the left

        Handles the rotation of a tile of the circuit, generating all the updates and notifications needed upon rotation
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where updates are being done
        position - Position of the tile to be rotated
        See Also:
        Tile.rotateLeft(Circuit)

      • rotateTileRight

        public void rotateTileRight​(Circuit circuit,
                            Position position)

        Rotates a tile of the circuit to the right

        Handles the rotation of a tile of the circuit, generating all the updates and notifications needed upon rotation
        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where updates are being done
        position - Position of the tile to be rotated
        See Also:
        Tile.rotateRight(Circuit)

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay​(Circuit circuit,
                     Position position,
                     long delay)

        Sets the delay of a tile of the circuit

        Parameters:
        circuit - Circuit where updates are being done
        position - Position of the tile to be rotated
        delay - New delay for the tile
